methods.name: <init>

params.name: model
params.comment: the RowObjectFilterModel of the table being filtered.

params.name: columnModel
params.comment: the TableColumnModel of the table being filtered.

params.name: currentColumnTableFilter
params.comment:
the currently applied TableColumnFilter or null if there is
 no current TableColumnFilter applied.

methods.name: createFilterRow
methods.comment: Creates a new filter fow (a new major row in the dialog filter panel)

params.name: logicOperation
params.comment: the logical operation for how this row interacts with the rows before it

return.comment: the new filter row that represents a major row in the dialog filter panel.

methods.javadoc:
Deletes a filter row (a major row in the dialog filter panel)
@param filterRow the row to delete.
methods.name: deleteFilterRow
methods.comment: Deletes a filter row (a major row in the dialog filter panel)

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of all filter rows in this model.
@return a list of all filter rows in this model.
methods.name: getFilterRows
methods.comment: Returns a list of all filter rows in this model.

return.comment: a list of all filter rows in this model.

methods.javadoc:
Adds a listener to be notified for various changes that occur in this filter model.
@param listener the listener to add.
methods.name: addListener
methods.comment: Adds a listener to be notified for various changes that occur in this filter model.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given listener.
@param listener the listener to remove.
methods.name: removeListener
isValid
methods.comment:
Checks if this model represents a valid filter. While editing, some elements of the filter
 may be incomplete or invalid and if so, then this method will return false.

return.comment: true if the model represents a valid filter.

methods.name: getTableColumnFilter
methods.comment: Builds a ColumnTableFilter from this model if the model is valid.

return.comment:
a new ColumnTableFilter based on the configuration of this model or null if the model
 is invalid.

methods.javadoc: Clears the model of all filters.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clears the model of all filters.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of the columnFilterData for all filterable columns in the table
@return a list of the columnFilterData for all filterable columns in the table
methods.name: getAllColumnFilterData
methods.comment: Returns a list of the columnFilterData for all filterable columns in the table

return.comment: a list of the columnFilterData for all filterable columns in the table

methods.javadoc:
Return true if there are no conditions (valid or invalid) defined for this filter model.
@return true if there are no conditions (valid or invalid) defined for this filter model.
methods.name: isEmpty
methods.comment: Return true if there are no conditions (valid or invalid) defined for this filter model.

return.comment: true if there are no conditions (valid or invalid) defined for this filter model.

methods.name: hasUnappliedChanges
methods.comment:
Returns true if this model has changes that make the filter different from the currently
 applied filter.

return.comment: if there are unapplied user changes to the filter.

name: ColumnFilterDialogModel
comment:
This class is for constructing and editing ColumnBasedTableFilter. It is used by the
 ColumnFilterDialog and exists primarily to make testing easier.
